intro: Argostemma stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. Argostemma stenophyllum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along streambanks.
